author: protolambda
content: *super experimental*: a python wrapper around Rumor, to script network programs elegantly: https://github.com/protolambda/pyrum

author: protolambda
content: Plan is to improve Rumor with more functionality and better field-logging (less data in the message, more as log fields), and then write tests in python.

author: protolambda
content: Still undecided for the client<>test setup approach. We probably need to restart a client for each serious test. Suggestions welcome.

author: djrtwo
content:
Thoughts on methods for seeding client with state and data (blocks, attestations, etc)?
Or do you anticipate just using a start-with-genesis-state feature on the client and seeding relevant info the client via Rumor and normal network operations

author: protolambda
content: The latter sounds better, avoiding special testing API requirements after already running a client would be good. The newer eth1 clients liked that as approach.

author: protolambda
content: Another thing; I'm adding a background feature to Rumor soon so that tasks can truely run concurrently, managed with async from the python script.
